attributes.action: The housing crisis is creating homelessness; we need lower rents and more houses
attributes.background: We want the Government to build more houses because the more houses there are, the cheaper they will be. The Government should introduce a new rent cap so that people can afford a house to live in. It's not a laughing matter and the Government cannot let this carry on because it is destroying lives!
attributes.additional_details:
We are class 5 and we are proud to present  Saint Mary's Catholic Primary School's petition. Homelessness is not a problem; it is a crisis. This needs to be addressed immediately.

So we do hope that this turns into reality because homelessness is no joke. How would you feel if you were homeless? Who would you turn to in your hour of need? Why is the Government not taking responsibility for this disturbing crisis? 

Sign this petition today or it could be you living on the streets tomorrow.

attributes.action: Stop Winchburgh village being used as a flight path for Edinburgh airport
attributes.background: Edinburgh Airport is proposing changes to their current flight paths.  They issued a consultation last year which did not include Winchburgh, therefore discouraging residents from responding. The new proposed flight paths now include Winchburgh meaning residents have been mislead.
attributes.additional_details: In the Phase 2 material, it is stated that flight paths have been devised based on feedback from Phase 1 consultation.  Proposed preferred flight paths C5 and D0 would fly directly over an area the consultation stated would be unaffected.  They are therefore unviable according to the rules governing changes to existing flight paths. One of the airport’s key criterion is noise impact on fewest people below 7000ft.  Population data from 2001 was used, showing 2k residents when it's closer to 10k.

attributes.action: Constitution to bar ceding of sovereignty to foreign powers without a referendum
attributes.background: This is to avoid what has happened in the past without the consent of the British people. Such as Edward Heath signing the European Communities act. And later with on other politicians signing the Maastricht & Lisbon treaties. In the case of Lisbon we were promised a referendum, but not given one

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to warn of lethal risks of food recycling bins.
attributes.background: Toxic mould from recycling caddies can be fatal to people & pets including cats & dogs due to risks of Mycotoxicosis.2 dogs recently, nearly died due to this,1 is still fighting for its life.Councils are currently failing to warn of potential lethal risks.We ask you ensure they do as a duty of care.
attributes.additional_details:
Below is the council concerned's link that doesn't appear to warn of lethal mould risks:http://www.dacorum.gov.uk/home/environment-street-care/recycling-refuse-waste/household-waste-recycling/food-waste-caddies 

See The Wheelhouse Veterinary Centre (1 of 3 vets treating the dogs) post about it:

https://www.facebook.com/TheWheelhouseVets/posts/1422334514507038 

800+ comments,1000+ reactions,7000+ shares in < 3 days  evidences owner trauma, public shock, lack of risk awareness & costs of £10K

attributes.action: Build a Train Station at the Terminal Building of Cardiff International Airport
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call on the Government to implement the above, accordingly intersecting the railway line which runs adjacent to the airport, and urge the relevant train operators to incorporate it into their regular timetables.

Cardiff Airport is in need of investment in order for it to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people in Wales feel that the airport is not within easy reach of the general public unless they have access to a private vehicle. The remote station in the village of Rhoose is an impractical substitute, and straightforward, competitive alternatives are limited.

This affects local passengers as well as visitors.

Rail infrastructure is not currently devolved to the Welsh Gov’t, and any new stations would be a decision for the UK Gov’t & Network Rail.

attributes.action: Ensure all apprentices are paid the National Minimum Wage for their age.
attributes.background: The current rate is £3.40 per hour as of October 2016, (rising to £3.50 as of April 2017)  for apprentices aged 16 to 18 and those aged 19 or over who are in their first year. All other apprentices are entitled to the National Minimum Wage for their age)
attributes.additional_details:
Apprentices who earn just £3.40 an hour are struggling to make ends meet.  This wage is not financially viable.  In addition, an apprentice can spend a high proportion of their wage travelling to work.  
Apprentices should be paid National Minimum Wage from the start. 
Apprenticeships can be an important way for young people to get into employment and earn while they learn. But young workers should not be used as cheap labour.  All young people deserve to be paid a decent minimum wage.

attributes.action: Only women have titles on driving licences. Remove this discriminatory process.
attributes.background:
Why does the DVLA need to print on a licence if a woman is married, but not if a man is? 

The DVLA only automatically lists the titles - Ms, Mrs, etc - of females. If males want their title listed, they have to specifically request it. This is a clear-cut case of sexism.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2010, an FOI request was sent to the DVLA, and further communication pointed out this anomaly between the treatment of women and men on driving licences:
https://www.complicity.co.uk/blog/2010/08/dvla-foi-request-driving-licence-titles/

In 7 years, the DVLA has not changed this policy. 

It claims to only add the title when a woman fills in the title in the form, yet not only has this been proven untrue, they do NOT automatically add the title when men fill it in.

This is clear sexism.

attributes.action: Make sharing content of disabled children with the intent to humiliate illegal.
attributes.background: The number of hate crime incidences against disabled people are increasing. This is fuelled by sharing disparaging social media content. Disabled children often don't have a voice to defend themselves so should have special protection against behaviour which feeds dangerous negative attitudes.

attributes.action: Create a register to put animal abusers on with bans for life.
attributes.background: Animals do not deserve abuse. One of the first indicators of a psychopath is animal cruelty. Therefore I am asking for a register to be created where anybody that has been convicted of abusing an animal is put on a register similar to the sex offenders register.
attributes.additional_details: There are continuously news stories of people who are hurting and killing innocent animals for no reason whatsoever. Look anywhere on social media and the news. It's disgusting behaviour and it's about time something more was done about it.

attributes.action: Scrap plans for HS2 and invest the money in our Armed Forces and NHS.
attributes.background: A country the size of Britain does not need this type of rail service. People on the average wage won't be able afford to use this just rich business people. This money spent on our NHS & Armed Forces would enable us to rebuild them to there former glorys!

attributes.action: Make stillbirth training mandatory for student midwifes before work placements
attributes.background: Many midwifes end up going out onto placement in hospitals without any experience or knowledge in how to deal with the emotional effects of stillbirth on parents. By making stillbirth training mandatory it will improve services provided to the parents they are dealing with in maternity wards.

attributes.action: DWP and its contractors to have mandatory training in understanding Autism.
attributes.background: Since the Conservative Govt have been in power and the treasury have stated that major changes will happen for AUSTERITY. Myself and many families looking after Autistic children/adults have been made to feel that AUTISM is not a disability. Many families are struggling with the loss of benefits.
attributes.additional_details: As a mother of 2 Autistic children I have joined many groups online.  Reading stories of family's being told they can no longer have benefits with a diagnosis of Autism. We need change to make DWP and its contractors aware that Autism is a lifelong, developmental disability that affects how a person communicates with and relates to other people, and how they experience the world around them, Without these benefits they cannot have carers or support please STOP AUSTERITY WITH AUTISM

attributes.action: Give grieving parents of a stillborn baby a birth certificate
attributes.background:
We lost our gorgeous son Bobby at 41 weeks. We never expected to be told there was no heartbeat.
He was perfect in every way yet we left the hospital a day later with a box and a death certifate. No birth certificate just a death certificate. As if our little boy was never here...
attributes.additional_details:
Looseing a child at any age is heartbreaking. You never get over the pain of leaving your child behind. It's not natural to any parent to part with them.
To go in to labour anxious and excited to meet ur tiny baby, to then have to leave the hospital empty handed. 
Your then told you don't get a birth certificate. Your baby isn't registered a child. 
All babies, no matter how long they have been here for, deserve to be recognised as a person. 
It's time this became the norm! 
Help all us grieving parents out there to make a simple change that would make the world of difference to a horrendous situation.

attributes.action: Reinstate Legal Aid for family law matters.
attributes.background: Many parents are struggling to arrange contact with their children following separation, and do not have the funds to employ legal representation. Dealing with the separation is hard enough, without trying to cope with the administrative side of things as well.

attributes.action: Waive bridge tolls for motorists in Warrington, Chester and Cheshire West.
attributes.background: Motorists will have to pay to cross the new Mersey Gateway Bridge and existing silver Jublee bridge – despite some being promised tolls would be scrapped to save them £1,080 a year. Sign to show your support for scrapping these charges.

attributes.action: Delay the decision to make cuts for specialist medication for rare illnesses.
attributes.background: Treatments for rare diseases are incredibly difficult to bring to market due to the small patient populations. It means that the cost per patient treated is therefore much higher. This doesn't mean that these individuals don't need the medication which successfully provide a better quality of life.
attributes.additional_details: The level of funding being proposed is much lower then many other treatments, and the decision to make cuts is being rushed through to quickly without taking serious consideration for the families and patients this will impact. By delaying the decision, this will allow patients groups more time to provide evidence that prove that this medication provides a better quality of life and also slows down the illness progressing as quickly as it would without the medication.

attributes.action: Restrict the amount of palm oil allowed in any product sold in the UK.
attributes.background:
The palm oil industry is contributing to mass deforestation through the clearing of rainforests for palm plantations, destroying habitats and driving extinction.
This petition asks for regulations on the source of palm oil, and restrictions to the % amount allowed in products sold in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Palm oil has found its way into 50% of all packaged foods on the supermarket shelves. Policy has already been passed to ensure that all of these products state they contain palm oil, however, this is not sufficient as these companies (such as Iceland, PepsiCo, and many make-up businesses) are still producing products containing a large percentage of palm oil that are sourced from unsustainable practices that are not RSPO approved.

attributes.action: Reduce Overseas Aid from 0.7% GDP to 0.35% to fund Social Care in the UK
attributes.background: Social Care in the UK is hugely underfunded. Meanwhile our Overseas Aid budget of 0.7% of GDP (@£12bn) is among the most generous in the world. Reduce the target to 0.35%, which is more in line with Germany 0.4%, Canada 0.3% and USA 0.2%, and release the estimated £6bn to fund Social Care in the UK.

attributes.action: Carry out the threat to leave the EU with no deal in the face of prevarication.
attributes.background: The number of threats coming from Brussels are clearly designed to delay and ultimately block British withdrawal from the EU. Instead of waiting two years for meaningless negotiations to conclude, the UK government should impose a time limit of six months for concrete progress or declare "No Deal".

attributes.action: Provide protection for closed railway track-beds to aid rural regeneration.
attributes.background: In the mid -1960's Dr Beeching was employed to find ways of making the railways more profitable and his report resulted in the closure of a large part of our railway network. The report failed to take into account the growth in population and the necessity for rural transport.
attributes.additional_details: The railways were mainly built under Act of Parliament. After closure Local Authorities have sold off railway land for development. Usage for footpaths and cycleways is fine. Building houses and industrial estates prevent regeneration of these railways. Scotrail have reopened part of the old Waverley route. Groups would like to reopen lines such as the Somerset, Dorset, Deeside line, Lynton & Barnstable and Matlock, Bakewell & Buxton and Cliffe Hill Mineral Railway. Local authorites should be required to aid projects and reject planning for developments.

attributes.action: Music venues, small business exemption from business rate increase set for April
attributes.background: Commercial property in the Uk will have its business rates revalued to mirror property value in the area. Indepedent business, music venues, theatres will close. Theresa May stand by your words "I want to build an economy that works for all, that means working with and listening to smaller firms.”

attributes.action: Condemn Trump's Muslim travel ban & accept those affected by it in the UK.
attributes.background: We ask the Prime Minister to condemn President Trump's orders banning citizens of Iraq, Iran, Syria, Yemen, Libya, Sudan and Somalia from entering the USA and preventing Muslim refugees from travelling to the USA. We also ask that the UK accepts all those turned away by the USA during this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
On Holocaust Memorial Day of all days, Donald Trump signed Executive Orders that amount to a de facto ban on Muslims and refugees entering the United States. On the same day, the UK Prime Minister met with him and proclaimed the strength of the friendship between our nations. Friends don't let friends enforce a bigoted, ineffective, paranoid and religiously-motivated border policy. 

The UK should model good humanitarian behaviour and accept all of those turned away by the US during this crisis.

attributes.action: Review and revoke private prison contracts and return to the public sector.
attributes.background: The government sold the contract for running some of our jails to private companies. These are now dangerous and staff are in fear every day of their working lives. PRISONS SHOULD NOT BE FOR PROFIT.

attributes.action: Make animal farming and production processes part of the national curriculum.
attributes.background: Our food and what we consume is a fundamental part of our lives as human beings. But many people are unaware of the reality of the production processes used within the meat, dairy, and egg industries.
attributes.additional_details: Explicit education, including actual filmed footage of these processes should be placed within the national curriculum as a compulsory subject within secondary education in the UK. This would help people, and especially future generations, to make more informed choices about what they wish to consume and fund through their spending on food and related products.

attributes.action: Put climate change at the top of the agenda in discussions with President Trump.
attributes.background: At this crucial time of establishing relationships with the new President, it should be made clear that climate change is the most pressing concern we currently have.

attributes.action: UK GOVERNMENT TO ACTIVELY PURSUE URGENT PEACE NEGOTIATIONS IN SYRIA
attributes.background: How long will this unrelentless suffering, mass destruction  and massacre of innocent lives continue to be silenced, ignored and accepted by the international community ?
attributes.additional_details:
After six years the Syrian civil war is increasing with rage  with no end in sight. 
Since the  war began, as many as 386,000 people have been killed, including nearly 14,000 children.  The war has become more deadly since foreign powers have joined the conflict.  The only way to end this catastrophe is for the world to stand together and remove Assad and his regime. 

Eastern Aleppo has become the key strategic battleground and an epitome of this brutal, barbaric and morally shameless and tragic war in Syria.  It has been besieged, bombed, starved and strangled as part of the Assad’s regime ‘Starve or Kneel’ strategy. 

Let's show the innocent children of Syria and its people that their lives do matter, that we do care and the world has not forgotten!

attributes.action: Stop scale down of Britains armed forces !
attributes.background:
Proposal to scale down Britains armed forces specifically losing HMS Ocean and 42 Commando along with Main Battle Tanks .

In current climate and with dwindling resources over last decade it is surely a rash perhaps foolish decision to keep cutting our nations defence !!
attributes.additional_details: Stop this policy of cutting back nations defence whilst purporting to be proud of the great Men and Women that serve .

attributes.action: Pass full-scale Glass-Steagall to break up The City’s Too-Big-To-Fail Banks!
attributes.background: The IMF, the BIS and many financial experts are warning of a new global financial crash far worse than 2008, which will be caused by the same forces: the unbridled speculation in derivatives, and outright criminal activity, of City of London and Wall Street megabanks.
attributes.additional_details: The USA's 1933 Glass-Steagall Act strictly separated deposit-taking commercial banks from speculative "investment banking", which had caused the Great Depression. Its repeal in 1999, on top of London’s 1986 Big Bang deregulation, led to the formation of Too-Big-To-Fail banks. Glass-Steagall is non-partisan: 445 UK MPs and Lords from all parties voted for it in 2013. The “ring-fence” legislated instead allows TBTF banks to continue the risky mingling of investment and commercial banking.

attributes.action: Condemn US travel ban, ensure no UK complicity in its enforcement.
attributes.background: The government should affirm that the travel ban is discriminatory,  contrary to international law and abhorrent, and consider steps to ensure that UK airports, airlines in UK airports or headquartered there and employees of the UK Government are not complicit in the travel ban.
attributes.additional_details: This petition follows the Prime Minister's inadequate response to the travel ban imposed by the United States Government on the nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries and suspension of refugee admissions  (in the Executive Order “Protecting the Nation from Terrorist Entry into the United States by Foreign Nationals” of 27 January 2017).

attributes.action: Ban the use of inhumane rodent glue traps in the UK
attributes.background:
Rodent glue traps are mats covered in a very sticky adhesive from which it's victims cannot escape. It can take hours, even days from being caught to being killed, in which time they will usually die from exhaustion in the attempt to escape.
Let's get these disgusting things banned. Thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Ireland and New Zealand have banned glue traps and many major stores around the world have stopped selling them.

attributes.action: Legalise medical marijuana for chronic and terminal conditions
attributes.background: Many people in the UK suffer from painful and life-threatening conditions, such as cancer, MS, and Parkinsons.; the synthetic drugs prescribed can have nasty side effects. Research from around the world has shown that medical marijuana can improve quality of life, with fewer side effects.
attributes.additional_details:
60 peer reviewed studies of medical marijuana
http://medicalmarijuana.procon.org/view.resource.php?resourceID=000884
United States FDA report
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/marijuana-medicine

attributes.action: Re-open the Shrewsbury to Stafford Railway Line via Wellington & Newport.
attributes.background: I attended interview in Cannock. 1 and half hours to get there by Rail. If we had a connection from Shrewsbury to Stafford, via Wellington & Newport I would have only travel fo 43 minutes, half the amount of time. The route should be Shrewsbury to Walsall via Wellington, Newport, Stafford & Rugely
attributes.additional_details: Association of Train Operating Companies, in its Connecting Communities: Expanding Access to the Rail Network report, called for funding to reopen the line from Stafford to Wellington as part of £500m scheme to open 33 stations on 14 lines closed in the Beeching Axe. A group called Shropshire, Telford & the Marches Strategic Rail Group voted to lobby government to invest in reopening the line, a quicker alternative of direct link to London. Estimated cost would be roughly £230 million.

attributes.action: Military personnel to have military hearing before they proceed to civil courts.
attributes.background: In the past any suggestion of wrong doing by military personnel was investigated by the military - if any was discovered and thought to be serious enough it was passed to the civil courts to deal with.

attributes.action: Can the exploration of Shale gas be given priority in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Despite promises by the government to speed up the exploitation of Shale gas, it seems to be stalled. Could the government be more dynamic in their approach to ensure that the United Kingdom benefits from Shale, especially as Brexit approaches

attributes.action: Protect Local Authority centrally held funding for Early Years Intervention
attributes.background:
Government changes to Early Years centrally held funding are threatening the existence of the outstanding Pen Green Centre, a pioneer in early years integration. 
NCC funds the majority of the centre's work via the centrally held fund and changes will inadvertently see a savage reduction in budget.
attributes.additional_details:
We know DfE did not intend to threaten the country’s largest and most innovative nursery school.
Whilst we support the principle of funds being redirected to the front line we urgently request the government ring-fence funds for Pen Green and other integrated nursery schools before February 2017. 

Furthermore we urge the government to enact a caveat to the future funding arrangements whereby integrated nursery schools are protected financially to continue their outstanding work from hereon in.

attributes.action: Examine the safeguarding procedures of Leicester City Council
attributes.background: we the undersigned request that the secretary of state review the procedures for safeguarding the welfare of vulnerable people who are elderly and living in their own homes and examine if Leicester City Council is meeting its obligations

attributes.action: Ban the testing of joined up handwriting in primary school SAT's.
attributes.background: There is currently an epidemic of illegible handwriting in our secondary schools. Primary schools have been forced to cut corners, using a continuous cursive method from Reception to simply tick the boxes of the handwriting statements in the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework.
attributes.additional_details: There is no long term benefit to this; it is simply to meet the Interim Teacher Assessment Framework handwriting statements, which contradicts the handwriting statements in the current National Curriculum. Also, we believe that it should be a statutory requirement that left handed pupils receive specific teaching to meet their needs, to help them master legible handwriting and continue to love writing.

attributes.action: Prevent Ministers and MP's to talk until debate runs out of time.
attributes.background: The Government to impose a time restriction on Ministers and MP's to talk in Private Members Bills debates in line with the time given to debate. The current system gives members the opportunity to talk until time runs out, shelving the debate. This is not democratic and discredits the system.
attributes.additional_details: The current system allows for Ministers and Members of Parliament to be able to talk out Private Members Bills when they know they are running out of time. Placing time restrictions on Members of Parliament and Ministers in attendance of the debate in relation to the time that can be given to a debate (minimum or maximum) to stop shelving Bills. Bills should be voted on in Parliament whether they progress to the next stage or refused without a third option, to talk out a debate.

attributes.action: Demand routine testing for dangerous and fatal infections during pregnancy
attributes.background: In 2014, I was pregnant with my daughter. I visited my doctor complaining of abdominal pain and was not testing for anything. A few weeks later I was rushed to hospital in preterm labour, and my baby was delivered at 20 weeks. She survived only 2 hours. I had chorioamnionitis that went untreated.
attributes.additional_details:
•25% of preterm labours are due to emergency events, including undiagnosed infections
•These infections can be detected with examinations, urine cultures, vaginal/rectal swabs and blood tests 
•If left undetected can cause inflammation of the fetal membranes/amniotic sac, leading a medical emergency named chorioamnionitis 
•Can trigger preterm contractions, premature rupture of membranes, placental abruption and imminent delivery 
•Delivery prior to 24 weeks is fatal, and otherwise dangerous

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discriminate against DSS in the rental sector
attributes.background: Make a change to the equality law for people in the rental market. Many working prospective tenants are in receipt of housing benefit or tax credit assistance to make up for the ever increasing cost of monthly rent. Stating 'no DSS' leaves many hard working families with little or no housing options
attributes.additional_details:
Changes to equality law for the rental market came into force in Ireland in January 2016, and as shown on bbc news on 09.03.17 it is a very real issue affecting many people in the UK:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-39102860

attributes.action: We the British public want our govt to offer the hand of friendship to Russia
attributes.background: With Donald J Trump as the new elect president of the United States of America and has recently offered the hand of friendship to Russia and Putin, we the British public do not see this as a threat and we want our government to offer the hand of friendship to Russia also.
attributes.additional_details:
In regards to the Independent newspaper publishing on 13/11/2016 Trump-Putin alliance sparks diplomatic crisis http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/trump-putin-alliance-sparks-diplomatic-crisis/ar-AAke2CD?ocid=spartanntp
We the British public want our government to offer a hand of friendship to Russia to work towards peace.
We the British public want our government to become allies with Russia.
We the British public do not want our government to plan on removing Assad from power in the east.

attributes.action: Make congenital heart defect a registered disability
attributes.background: Many babies each year are born with heart defects, these babies face many tests, procedures and surgeries throughout there lives. As an adult with a congenital heart defect I'm facing increasing problems but there's a lack of support as heart conditions aren't a recognised disability.

attributes.action: Bring retention bonuses to all branches of the Royal Navy. To retain experience.
attributes.background: Financial retention is currently only offered to engineers, but many other branches are struggling for manpower. We need to retain the knowledge and experience, rather than banking on getting the few that join through the ranks with very little military experience.

attributes.action: Remove Council Tax Payments for families earning below £22000 a year.
attributes.background: Council tax is forever growing year upon year. With each new financial tax year we see it rise by a percentage every year. When will it become tone expensive to pay. Why do we have to pay such high tariffs. NOW is the time to help struggling families who scrape every penny together.

attributes.action: Repeal the European Communities Act, 1972
attributes.background: In enacting the European Communities Bill through an ordinary vote in the House of Commons, Ted Heath's Government breached the constitutional convention which requires a prior consultation of the people (either by a general election or a referendum) on any measure involving constitutional change.

attributes.action: Give right to remain for commonwealth citizens who serve in the UK Armed Forces
attributes.background: There are cases of Commonwealth citizens who've served in the UK Armed Forces and once out, do not have the automatic right to remain. One case involves a Jamaican who served in the Royal Navy but his application has taken over a year, meanwhile he cannot work or claim benefits. This must change!

attributes.action: Regulate the rent of student houses, making it fair for all students.
attributes.background:
In the U.K. Student housing in unaffordable. 

It's clear that Landlords of student houses are taking advantage of students and over charging for their properties. 

Many students within the UK struggle to survive with the remainder of their loan after rent.
attributes.additional_details:
According to the NUS website an average student living outside of London pays £4'834 a year for rent. This is more than half of the maximum maintainance loan you can apply for. Not forgetting a lot of students get much less then this. 

The average student in London pays £6'143 for accommodation. 

We propose that the government takes action to help protect the next generation of academics by regulating the amount student landlords can charge for rent.

attributes.action: Allow 16 and 17 year olds to vote in the General Election on the 8th of June.
attributes.background: During this uncertain time so many changes are gonna affect the youngest in society more so than the older half, especially seeing how 16 and 17 year olds did not vote during the brexit referendum I think they should have the voice now to decide on which party will lead the negotiations.

attributes.action: Introduce a form for an optician to check vision at license reissue for over 70
attributes.background: The current system means that at 70 and at regular intervals afterwards, drivers are simply required to state whether they can see at the required distance without any need to get vision checked . As an optician I know people ignore advice regularly . A 3 year old girl died recently due to this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/03/20/pensioner-mowed-toddler-had-warned-not-drive-just-weeks-earlier/amp/

Article on the little girl that died

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on all Government buildings and schools permanently
attributes.background: We believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings and schools on a permanent basis. We are a proud nation and there is nothing wrong with expressing our patriotism. We should express it by flying our Union Flag.
